info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 2:41PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Garfield...southeastern Wayne and northwestern San Juan Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 241 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Hite Marina, or 31 miles southeast of Hanksville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hite Marina. This includes Utah Route 95 between mile markers 45 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
